revised_title: Development of Thymus, Epithelial Bodies, and Thyroid in Marsupialia
tldr: This study examines the development of the thymus, epithelial bodies, and thyroid in marsupials, specifically Phascolarctos (koala) and Phascolomys (wombat). The research focuses on the cervical thymus gland and its presence in these species. The authors also discuss the development of the thyroid gland and the role of epithelial bodies in the marsupial embryo.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
